examples.title: Rectangular Prism Volume
examples.description: Calculate volume of a rectangular prism with length 5, width 3, and height 4
examples.explanation: Volume = length × width × height = 5 × 3 × 4 = 60 cubic units

examples.title: Triangular Pyramid Volume
examples.description: Calculate volume of a triangular pyramid with base length 6, base height 4, and pyramid height 8
examples.explanation: Volume = (1/3) × base area × height = (1/3) × (0.5 × 6 × 4) × 8 = (1/3) × 12 × 8 = 32 cubic units

tips: Always use consistent units when measuring (all in inches, feet, meters, etc.)
For rectangular prisms, any face can be considered the base
For triangular pyramids, the base height is perpendicular to the base length
Double-check your measurements to ensure accurate calculations
Volume is always expressed in cubic units (cubic inches, cubic feet, cubic meters, etc.)
Remember that pyramid volume is always 1/3 of the volume of a prism with the same base and height

examples.title: Storage Box
examples.scenario: Calculate the volume of a storage box that is 2 feet long, 1.5 feet wide, and 1 foot tall
examples.calculation: V = l × w × h = 2 × 1.5 × 1 = 3 cubic feet
examples.result: The storage box has a volume of 3 cubic feet
